reviews.review_msg: Great prof. However im not a fan of her TA's.

Seems very enthusiastic during lecture but not as approachable in person. Lectures slides were organised. Daily participation tasks don't enrich learning and wastes paper. Forced us to sit in front half, which sucks for small bladdered people and those who think the projector slide view is better in the back rather up close.  TA very unhelpful. .

I had her for Psyc 363 at SFU. She's very clear and thorough. She uses lots of real world examples in her lectures which helped me a lot since I was new to some of the concepts. Overall, an excellent prof.
amazing prof!! makes lecture very interesting, and is very clear on expectations.
Take her class while she's still teaching for marks

She means well and puts a ton of effort into preparing lectures and "fun" class activities but lectures still end up being very dull. Participation is heavy, definitely go to class. The worst part were the assignments, marking seemed very subjective and there was little room for creativity. I strongly recommend going to the TA's office hours.

Lisa is very organized and lays out exactly what she wants for the papers and exams. The class material is interesting and applicable to real life, made me want to be more sustainable! highly recommended; it's generally easy common sense stuff and you learn a lot about the environment !

Lisa's lectures drag on as she constantly repeats herself in a slow, irritating voice. She doesn't organize herself efficiently which results in having to finish lectures next class. If she does finish, instead of ending class early, she starts the next lecture. I only attended for the participation marks and would not recommend taking her class.

Lisa is well prepared and her expectations are clear. She repeats and outlines important information needed to get the grades. Her exams come directly from lecture and from the readings. Her papers are marked exactly how she outlines. She does useful and fun demonstrations and is very engaging. I really enjoyed her classes and her teaching style.

The in class demonstrations by Lisa were fantastic. The evidence of preparation and the time she takes to help her students are what makes her great. I loved the writing assignments because their instructions were very clear. Work hard and you will see results!

Lisa is really nice and social psych is super easy. However,  I found her awfully boring. I can't pay attention in class because she really doesn't make it interesting. I do enjoy social psych but she made me feel like it's dry when it isn't. I also never bought the textbook and still did great.

Lisa is very kind and means well but I did not like the class. I was not able gain knowledge in psychology. My mark was affected due to her lack of communication to the class on what she expected. As well, she is willing to give help but sometimes she does not understand what you are asking. I did not enjoy her class.

Lisa is by far the most amazing professor I have had at SFU! She is very thorough and super organized in regards to lecture material and homework assignments. She is super friendly and has such a great sense of humour! Her classes are not hard if you do the readings and study her lecture notes.

Lisa was fantastic. She's a clear concise lecturer who really seems to be knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the material.  Tests are fair. The assignments are relevant to the class material.  It also helps that she is very prepared and organized for lectures. If you have the opportunity to take a class with her I would completely recommend it.

Loved Lisa. Clear, concise, engaging lecturer. The papers were interesting and so was the textbook.  Very well prepared and approachable. Exams were fair and she did not try to trick. Study the lecture slides and the assigned reading's (mostly research articles). Attendance a must for participation mark (easy 10-15%).  Great!

I loved Lisa. She is super helpful and clear. Her classes are slightly boring, due to the material, but she tries to make it entertaining. Exams were straightforward and 3 papers are quite easy. She's an awesome teacher!
